PageTitle: mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive
FuncDef:
The mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive command enables proactive single-ended frame loss measurement (LM) on the ingress of an LSP.
The undo mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive command deletes the configuration.
By default, proactive single-ended frame LM is disabled on the ingress of an LSP
CLIs: mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive [ exp <exp-value> ] { <tunnel-type> <tunnel-number> | <tunnel-name> }
undo mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive { <tunnel-type> <tunnel-number> | <tunnel-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a priority value for LMMs.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The larger the value, the higher the priority. The default value is 7.

Specifies the tunnel type and number.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] mpls oam ingress lost-measure single-ended proactive exp 1 tunnel 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Packet LM is a performance monitoring function provided by MPLS-TP. Single-ended frame LM is implemented on two MEPs over an LSP. The measurement results include the following data:
Near-end frame loss: indicates the number and percentage of dropped frames that are sent from an RMEP to a MEP.Far-end frame loss: indicates the number and percentage of dropped frames that are sent from a MEP to an RMEP.

Prerequisites
MPLS and MPLS OAM have been enabled globally.The MPLS-OAM view has been displayed.The LSP that MPLS OAM monitors has been established.

Precautions
This function must be enabled on both the local and remote ends to display correct statistics about proactive single-ended frame loss measurement on the local end.The system can display a maximum of 60 proactive single-ended frame LM records.If the number of proactive single-ended frame LM records exceeds 60, the earlier records are overwritten.
